thread.title: Spurrier resigns, takes blame for South Carolina's slide
thread.title_full: Spurrier resigns, takes blame for South Carolina's slide

title: Spurrier resigns, takes blame for South Carolina's slide
text:
Updated: 12:17 p.m. Tuesday, Oct. 13, 2015 | Posted: 12:17 p.m. Tuesday, Oct. 13, 2015 Spurrier resigns, takes blame for South Carolina's slide Related View Larger FILE - In this Saturday, Sept. 19, 2015, South Carolina coach Steve Spurrier directs his team from the sideline during the first half of an NCAA college football game against Georgia in Athens, Ga. A person close to the situation says Spurrier told his team on Monday, Oct. 12, 2015, that he was retiring, effective immediately. The person spoke to The Associated Press on condition of anonymity because South Carolina has not publicly announced Spurrier's decision or who will be interim coach. (AP Photo/John Bazemore, File) View Larger FILE - in this Sept. 29, 2012 file photo, South Carolina coach Steve Spurrier gestures to an official during the first quarter of an NCAA college football game against Kentucky in Lexington, Ky. A person close to the situation says Spurrier told his team on Monday, Oct. 12, 2015, that he was retiring, effective immediately. The person spoke to The Associated Press on condition of anonymity because South Carolina has not publicly announced Spurrier's decision or who will be interim coach. (AP Photo/James Crisp) View Larger FILE - In this Dec. 26, 2014 file photo, South Carolina coach Steve Spurrier gestures during a news conference in Shreveport, La. A person close to the situation says Spurrier told his team on Monday, Oct. 12, 2015, that he was retiring, effective immediately. The person spoke to The Associated Press on condition of anonymity because South Carolina has not publicly announced Spurrier's decision or who will be interim coach. (AP Photo/Rogelio V. Solis) View Larger FILE - In this Oct. 13, 2012 file photo, South Carolina coach Steve Spurrier, left, reacts on the sideline in the second half of an NCAA college football game against LSU in Baton Rouge, La. A person close to the situation says Spurrier told his team on Monday, Oct. 12, 2015, that he was retiring, effective immediately. The person spoke to The Associated Press on condition of anonymity because South Carolina has not publicly announced Spurrier's decision or who will be interim coach. (AP Photo/Gerald Herbert) Sponsored Links The Associated Press COLUMBIA, S.C. â€” 
Steve Spurrier says that he made the decision to resign as South Carolina's head coach because the team was heading in the wrong direction. 
He told a news conference Tuesday: "We've slipped. It's my fault. I'm the head coach." 
Spurrier was in the middle of his 11th season. The Gamecocks were 2-4 overall and 0-4 in the Southeastern Conference for the first time in Spurrier's career. 
He had never had a losing season in 25 previous seasons coach at Duke (1987-89), Florida (1990-2001) or South Carolina, where he has been since 2005. 
___
